title.narrative: IR 3.3 JUSTICE POUR DES ENFANTS

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 3.3: By the end of 2018, a juvenile justice system (including juvenile courts, mediation committees, alternatives to custody and child-centered police units) is functional in all 11 provinces of the DRC ., which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTIONPCR 3: By the end of 2018, the prevention and protection against all forms of violence, abuse and exploitation, as well as access to state civil service and legal protection, are significantly and equitably reinforced.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3.3: By the end of 2018, a juvenile justice system (including juvenile courts, mediation committees, alternatives to custodyand child-centered police units) is functional in all 11 provinces of the DRC .

description.narrative: In 2019, a total of 40,793 children (15,140 girls; 25,653 boys) compared to 19,725 children in 2018 accessed a specialized juvenile justice system, tailored to their specific needs and which incorporates alternatives to detention and diversion, through mediation. This has allowed 43% of children in conflict with the law to be given non-custodial sentences while 119 children (27 girls; 92 boys) benefited from a mediated settlement. Furthermore, 71% of all children in contact with this specialized justice system were assisted by a lawyer. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
